item.title: PlayStation Announces New Beta Program To Test Upcoming Features
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/playstation-announces-new-beta-program-to-test-upcoming-features/

PlayStation has announced its new beta program, allowing players to have a “more consolidated way” to test new features across “a wide range of PlayStation experiences.”

In a post on the PlayStation blog, SIE’s senior director of content communications Sid Shuman wrote that the new program will “create an easy, centralized place for you to register your interest in a range of future PlayStation betas.”

“A single registration for Beta Program at PlayStation will allow you to express interest in gaining beta access to test participating games for the PS5 console and PC, new PS5 console features, PlayStation App features, and even user experience features on PlayStation.com,” he said. “You only need to sign up once to express interest in these various betas…”

PODCAST: Wonder Woman Canceled And Is It The Games Media’s Fault?

Registering your interest is free and open globally. To be eligible, those interested have to meet various requirements, including:

  • Players must have a valid account for PlayStation Network in good standing with a current email address. Accounts with restrictions or violations may not be eligible for participation.
  • Players must live in the region where Beta Program at PlayStation is available.
  • Players must meet the legal age requirement for their region.

Shuman said that depending on the specific beta, space will be limited. Signing up won’t guarantee acceptance for specific opportunities.

More details on future betas will be announced at a later time.

For more Insider Gaming, check out our exclusive details on Ubisoft restarting the development of the Far Cry multiplayer game. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: All 2025 BAFTA Games Awards Nominations and Predictions
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/all-2025-bafta-games-awards-nominations-and-predictions/

The BAFTA team has revealed the full suite of nominations for the 2025 BAFTA Games Awards, one of the most prestigious awards ceremonies in the wide world of gaming. This year’s event marks the 21st iteration of the showcase, and more than 40 games have received nominations.

Check out the full list of 2025 BAFTA Games Awards nominations below to find out if your favourite game of 2024 made the cut.

2025 Nominations

This is the full list of nominations – enjoy!

Animation

  • Astro Bot
  • Black Ops 6
  • LEGO Horizon Adventures – Prediction
  • Hellblade II
  • Thank Goodness You’re Here!
  • Space Marine 2

Artistic Achievement

  • Astro Bot
  • Black Myth: Wukong
  • Harold Halibut
  • Neva – Prediction
  • Hellblade II
  • Still Wakes The Deep

Audio Achievement

  • Animal Well
  • Astro Bot
  • Helldivers 2
  • Hellblade II – Prediction
  • Star Wars Outlaws
  • Still Wakes The Deep

Best Game

  • Astro Bot – Prediction
  • Balatro
  • Black Myth: Wukong
  • Helldivers 2
  • Thank Goodness You’re Here
  • The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom

British Game

  • A Highland Song
  • LEGO Horizon Adventures
  • Paper Trail
  • Hellblade II
  • Still Wakes The Deep – Prediction
  • Thank Goodness You’re Here

Debut Game

  • Animal Well
  • Balatro – Prediction
  • Pacific Drive
  • Tales of Kenzera: Zau
  • Thank Goodness You’re Here!
  • The Plucky Squire

Evolving Game

  • Diablo IV
  • Final Fantasy XIV Online
  • No Man’s Sky – Prediction
  • Sea of Thieves
  • Vampire Survivors
  • World of Warcraft

Family

  • Astro Bot – Prediction
  • Cat Quest III
  • LEGO Horizon Adventures
  • Little Kitty, Big City
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree
  • The Plucky Squire

Game Beyond Entertainment

  • Botany Manor
  • Kind Words 2
  • Hellblade II
  • Tales of Kenzera: Zau – Prediction
  • Tetris Forever
  • Vampire Therapist

Game Design

  • Animal Well
  • Astro Bot – Prediction
  • Balatro
  • Helldivers II
  • Tactical Breach Wizards
  • Echoes of Wisdom

Multiplayer

  • Black Ops 6
  • Helldivers II – Prediction
  • LEGO Horizon Adventures
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree
  • TEKKEN 8
  • Space Marine 2

Music

  • Astro Bot
  • Black Myth: Wukong
  • Final Fantasy VII Rebirth – Prediction
  • Helldivers II
  • Hellblade II
  • Star Wars Outlaws

Narrative

  • Black Myth: Wukong
  • Dragon Age: The Veilguard
  • Final Fantasy VII Rebirth
  • Metaphor: ReFantazio
  • Hellblade II – Prediction
  • Still Wakes The Deep

New Intellectual Property

  • Animal Well
  • Balatro – Prediction
  • Black Myth: Wukong
  • Metaphor: ReFantazio
  • Still Wakes The Deep
  • Thank Goodness You’re Here

Performer in a Leading Role

  • Alec Newman – Still Wakes The Deep
  • Humberly Gonzalez – Star Wars Outlaws
  • Isabella Inchbald – Indika
  • Luke Roberts – Silent Hill 2 – Prediction
  • Melina Juergens – Hellblade II
  • Y’lan Noel – Black Ops 6

Performer in a Supporting Role

  • Abbi Greenland & Helen Goalen – Hellblade II
  • Aldis Amah Hamilton – Hellblade II
  • Jon Blyth – Thank Goodness You’re Here!
  • Karen Dunbar – Still Wakes The Deep
  • Matt Berry – Thank Goodness You’re Here! – Prediction
  • Michael Abubakar – Still Wakes The Deep

Technical Achievement

  • Astro Bot
  • Black Myth: Wukong – Prediction
  • Black Ops 6
  • Hellblade II
  • Tiny Glade
  • Space Marine 2

Which games do you want to see win the most BAFTA Awards? Let us know in the comments!

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out our breakdown of all the Assassin’s Creed Shadows pre-order bonuses

The Far Cry extraction-based shooter under codename Maverick has been rebooted, Insider Gaming has learned.

Acclaim Returns As Publisher Under New Owners After 20 Years

After more than 20 years, Acclaim is returning as a publisher to help support indie games and “resurrect and revitalize its beloved portfolio”
